About Me

Riviera Sperduto

Philadelphia-based Full Stack Developer, Cloud/Solutions Architect, and AI Developer with a strong foundation in mathematics and computer science. I blend analytical thinking with creative problem-solving to build elegant, efficient, and user-friendly solutions.

Beyond technology, I'm a classically trained tenor vocalist and former small business owner. This unique combination of technical expertise, musical training, and entrepreneurial experience gives me a diverse perspective that enhances my approach to problem-solving and project development.

Full Stack Development Cloud Architecture AI Development Mathematics Music Philadelphia

Professional Journey

My technical journey spans multiple domains from web development to cloud architecture and artificial intelligence. I've worked on projects ranging from gamified learning platforms to disaster response simulations.

With experience in both front-end and back-end technologies, I bring a holistic perspective to software development. I'm passionate about creating applications that not only function well but also provide an excellent user experience.

I'm constantly exploring new technologies and approaches, believing that continuous learning is essential in our rapidly evolving field.

Educational Background

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

Temple University | Philadelphia, PA

GPA: 3.52

Associate's Degree in Mathematics

Community College of Philadelphia | Philadelphia, PA

GPA: 3.73

Bachelor of Music in Vocal Performance (Partial)

Penn State University | State College, PA

2014-2016

My multidisciplinary educational background provides me with a unique perspective for solving complex problems. The analytical skills from mathematics, technical expertise from computer science, and creative training from music complement each other in my professional work.

Technical Interests

  • Full Stack Web Development

    Building complete applications with React, Node.js, and modern frontend frameworks

  • Cloud Solutions Architecture

    Designing scalable and cost-effective cloud infrastructures using Microsoft Azure

  • AI and Machine Learning

    Developing intelligent applications and exploring practical applications of AI

  • Game Modding and Development

    Creating mods and exploring game development as both a hobby and technical challenge

Creative Pursuits

Beyond coding, I have a deep passion for music and other creative activities. These pursuits provide a perfect balance to my technical work and often inspire new ways of thinking about programming challenges.

Music

I enjoy exploring musical compositions, playing instruments, and singing in my free time. Music helps me think more creatively about problem-solving.

Gaming & Entertainment

I'm an avid video game player, anime enthusiast, and enjoy tabletop games with friends. These activities help me understand user experiences from different perspectives.

My Philadelphia Journey

Since moving to Philadelphia in 2017, I've developed a deep connection to this historic city. The vibrant tech community here instantly made me feel at home and has been instrumental in shaping my career and professional network.

My educational journey at Temple University and the Community College of Philadelphia has given me a strong foundation and local perspective that I bring to all my projects. I'm passionate about contributing to Philadelphia's growing reputation as a technology hub.

Musical Performances

Music Career

Semi-Professional Singer

As a tenor vocalist, I've performed in various concerts and productions throughout the Philadelphia area. My musical journey complements my technical career, providing a creative outlet that enhances my problem-solving abilities.

Current Positions:

  • Tenor Section Leader at Church of the Good Samaritan (Oct 2021-Current)
  • Music Teacher - voice and piano in Philadelphia city (Jan 2025-Current)

Teaching Experience:

  • Music Teacher at Meridee Winters School of Music (Aug 2023-Aug 2024)

I have experience teaching music lessons to students of various ages and skill levels. I enjoy sharing my passion for music and helping others develop their musical abilities.

Concert Experience:

  • Tenor Soloist - Mendelssohn's Ave Maria (Temple University Singers, Fall 2023)
  • Tenor 1 - Glen Loch Men's Chorale Concert (Glen Loch Men's Chorale, Fall 2023)
  • Tenor Soloist - Hermit Songs (Church of the Good Samaritan Concert Series, Summer 2023)
  • Tenor Soloist - Dichterliebe (Church of the Good Samaritan Concert Series, Summer 2023)
  • Tenor 1 - Beauty of The Day with Chanticleer (Philadelphia Chorale, Spring 2022*)
  • Tenor 2 - Bent But Not Broken Conference (Choir School of Delaware, Spring 2022)
  • Tenor 1 - Carmen (Boheme Opera NJ, Spring 2024)
  • Tenor 1 - Missa Pro Gloria Dei (Valley Forge Chorale, Spring 2024*)
  • * - world premiere

Education:

  • Penn State University - BM Vocal Performance (2014-2016)
  • Community College of Philadelphia - AS Mathematics (2021-2023)
  • Temple University - BS Computer Science (2023-2025)

Entrepreneurial Experience

Former Small Business Owner

I previously founded and operated "Philly Personal Shoppers," a local business that provided personalized shopping services to clients in the Philadelphia area. This entrepreneurial experience taught me valuable lessons about customer service, time management, and business operations that I apply to my technical projects.

My background as a small business owner gives me unique insight into the challenges faced by entrepreneurs and businesses of all sizes. This perspective helps me create more effective and practical technical solutions that address real business needs.
